website_summaries.verdict: A perfectly adequate quad chair for short-term sitting at games or while camping, though it may not last more than a season or two.
pros: Petite owners find this chair very comfortable, not sitting too high off the ground
Fairly light and easy to carry
Sturdy for its size, supporting resting firefighters and teenagers without a problem
cons: Angle of the chair back is too steep for some owners, making them uncomfortable
Many users found the chair too small to sit in
Fabric can detach from attachment points after a few uses

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than average, buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this chair, beware that is smaller than average size. I bought a similar chair from Walmart a few years ago. This Coleman chair is several inches smaller in seat width as well as back height. It may be suitable for a woman, however as a 5'10" male, it's too small for me to sit comfortably. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Wilt

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a little over 2 years old and used for perhaps 7 camping trips (Each 2 days)
customer_reviews.text: The metal frame broke after a little over 2 years (bought in May 2014) Did not use this chair excessively and it was well looked after so I was a little surprised when the metal frame broke rendering it completely useless. That being said it was worth the price we paid for it Bought in May 2014
customer_reviews.author: kay

customer_reviews.title: Bad design.
customer_reviews.text: Second time using this chair, it broke. Broke right where a hole had been drilled. An obvious weak spot, and design flaw. The worst part is soon after buying it, I saw it at Home Depot for half the price. $7.00. Yes, the exact chair.
customer_reviews.author: N. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Usually a fan of coleman and their products!! ...
customer_reviews.text: Usually a fan of coleman and their products!!! However, this chair only lasted ONE use before one of the rivets snapped and broke! I attached photos so beware.
customer_reviews.author: Here for youTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: cheap price for cheap comfort
customer_reviews.text: The back of the chair is at a steep angle which is not very comfortable. I would not buy another one, I guess that is why they are so cheap. Don't buy it for the name, this is not a very good Coleman product.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Olszewski

customer_reviews.title: carry bag is very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Chair is alright but the carry bag ripped on the very first day of use. Coleman says it was "free" and won't replace. Not a very portable chair if you can't sling it over your shoulder. The bag is made of very light material and the seam on the bottom gave way while being carried, first time out. I would return except that I will only be sent another one, with exactly the same problem. Also, trying to find cardboard big enough to box it up is a nuisance. I will have to try to figure out a work-around.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, inexpensive chair for backyard or beach
customer_reviews.text: This folding chair is convenient for the yard or beach, and well made for the price. It’s not terribly comfortable for lounging, as it’s very straight-backed, and it isn’t really a “camping chair” if by camping you mean backpacking off into the woods somewhere (too big and too heavy), but it is easily light enough to toss into the trunk and then carry down to the beach. I’m giving it five stars, because for the quality, the price is surprisingly low. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Portista

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, will easily break
customer_reviews.text: We bought these chairs after reading the good reviews. We were excited when they arrived, they looked like good outdoor chairs. However after about a month of use the armrest on one of the chairs broke. The metal just sheared off. I was sitting on it, and all I did was to place my arm on it and lean to one side to reach something. Picture of the broken chair is attached. Its done for and belongs to the garbage now. For $25 a better quality is expected than something that breaks if someone puts pressure on it. Buy it if what you're looking for is a fragile piece of deck furniture.
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I spend a lot of time sitting and waiting while my son is at practice. Bleachers are hard and very uncomfortable. I wanted to be able to sit where I wanted, comfortably. This chair does just that. I'm comfortable and the mesh keeps my cooler than other chairs. It's easy to set up and put back in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: KaseyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and uncomfortable!!
customer_reviews.text: I am shocked at how small and uncomfortable this chair is. I am 5' 9" female of average weight and this chair is much too small for me. Also, it's incredibly uncomfortable to sit it. I can't lean back at all, and the tops of the chair legs in the front dig into the back of my legs. It also seems flimsy. I bought this to replace a similar folding camp chair that I bought years ago at OSH (not Coleman brand). I assume this chair would be similar but it's much smaller basically so painful to sit in that it's unusable. I think it would only be suitable for a child or a petite woman.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for, in this case not very much as the chairs are not sturdy and very small.
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are the poorest quality I have ever purchased. I am a tall man under the weight capacity and they are uncomfortable and they feel cheap. These were a decent price, but why go cheap when it isn't going to last. I will be returning these chairs and spending more money on the next chair I purchase. These chairs might work for smaller people or children, but don't waste your time otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: R. Watts

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price cheap comfort cheap build
customer_reviews.text: Cheap price and not very comfortable. The seat back is very upright and doesn't fit in with the laid back camping vibe. Build quality is as expected for a cheap chair, i don't expect them to last more than a few trips. I will continue to use my much more comfortable REI X-tra chair and let the poor saps that didn't bring their own chairs suffer through these Colemans.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Seems really good and at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: These chairs seem totally satisfactory to us and we are glad to have them. Easy to carry, easy to put back in carrying sack and good to sit on. (We had seen some negative reviews, and I'm glad we were not put off by them, because we have not found any of them to ring true for our chairs.)
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Reeds

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy.
customer_reviews.text: They advertised that this chair was light and easy to Carry. I tried to pick it up and saw immediately that it was too heavy for me to carry so I never even opened it. Because I was beyond the 30 day return the company would not take it back.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different chair... won't last long.
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these chairs a few years ago, we've used them on maybe a dozen camping trips. One was wobbly from the beginning but I didn't think much of it because Coleman usually makes quality products but then one of the rivets broke and not the chair is useless. The other chair is wobbly now as well, so its only a matter of time before we have to replace that one as well. I got more use out of the cheap $5 Walmart brand one I had prior to this.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Nice chair, hurts my legs after an hour
customer_reviews.text: I use this chair to watch sports and practices. If I sit in it over an hour the front edge hurts my legs. Otherwise it's awesome. I tried several different chairs before choosing this one - it's the best I have found so far . Light weight is the killer app here!
customer_reviews.author: Techmeister

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Camp Chair
customer_reviews.text: Not a lot of color choice, but red works fine. The chair has a nice bag, and it actually fits back in the bag without a lot of hassle. Bag has a carry strap. Lightweight. It was the least expensive, so maybe the other chairs are sturdier, but this one is very sturdy. It's comfortable for a camp chair. There's a cup holder. No massage! Happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Welch

customer_reviews.title: breezy good chair at a nice breeze of a price
customer_reviews.text: We ordered one chair and then another because of the great value and comfort of them. The chairs come with a little transport bag which makes walking to the beach easier :) The mesh back design isn't very appealing but necessary in the Florida heat. Updated rating to five stars as it lasted longer than last ones we had and still cost less than available options at retail stores.
customer_reviews.author: Nighthawk

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, but still portable
customer_reviews.text: This chair is a bit more substantial than I had envisioned -- sturdier and heavier. That said, it is also very comfortable, a good choice if you want to sit for hours. Good back support, nice height, folds in seconds. I normally carry the chair in its bag, slung over my shoulder, for a few city blocks while I walk to the park. This can get a bit heavy for me, but I am a small woman. Overall, very good design and craftsmanship. A++++
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Y.

customer_reviews.title: I love this chair, wound up buying 3
customer_reviews.text: My kids do soccer and flag football so I am ALWAYS dragging a chair and a cooler to a field somewhere. This is perfect, it's relatively lightweight, packs up quickly and fits in the trunk. I bought one for my husband, one for my mother and one for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy Brigette

customer_reviews.title: Armrests don't stay up.
customer_reviews.text: It's a camp chair. It's got simple jobs. Support your butt, support your elbows, hold a beverage. I suppose one out of three isn't terrible, but the armrest on this thing falls if you lean on it at all funny, dropping the support out and potentially spilling your drink. Kind of a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Ghattas

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: Had this chair since February, it's now August and the metal snapped completely...which is funny because I had a similar off-brand chair that lasted well over 6 years...the fabric ripped, but the metal never snapped...I'd say this chair received camping moderate use...took it out maybe 4 times...and I couldn't tell you how it happened...but I can tell you why...because it's junk. Just spend the extra $10 and get something nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Razmig

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great little chair. Convenience and quality You would expect from Coleman. I was looking for a nice little chair that I could just throw in my car and use anywhere. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: JulieG

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for your Buck! (at least where camp chairs are concerned)
customer_reviews.text: Camping chairs come in so many varieties and shapes and levels of comfort, but they also tend to be way more expensive than one such as myself may be willing to pay. These chairs are great, not the most comfortable but they feel very sturdy when sitting and they are very reasonably priced. The mesh back is an added bonus for summer camping (ew sweaty backs = no fun) haven't done any cold weather camping with them yet but I would hope you brought the proper layers so it wouldn't be a factor ;)
customer_reviews.author: Keegan L.

customer_reviews.title: I like it! Can’t put my hyrdroflask in the cup holder
customer_reviews.text: I like it. My boys play soccer and baseball so we will definitely use this up all year long! So my hydro flask doesn’t fit even my small hydro flask.big bummer! I like the back mesh sorry it doesn’t show in this picture but i’m a heavy gal,yes i get hot easily! It’s only been my first week of using this but i like it! It’s sturdy,a bit bigger than the other ones i see like target brand,Walmart,big 5 ...just slightly bigger. Minus the one star for not being able to hold my hydro flask.
customer_reviews.author: NICO

customer_reviews.title: Good recommendation
customer_reviews.text: I sat on my friend's chair and felt comfortable. I bought one.
customer_reviews.author: MPK

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow at front edge of the seat.
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews, I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my husband. They said how wide it was,and comfortable. My husband is not that big of a guy,but found it too narrow. Not at the seat,but at the front edge where your thighs would be. I had to return the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Debra F.

customer_reviews.title: Park your butt here
customer_reviews.text: Bought four of these for football games. They are a basic standard folding chair with a really nice mesh back. For the price I would buy these over and over again. They work great and are comfortable to sit in. The mesh back lets your back breathe without sweating. Lightweight easy to store and carry.
customer_reviews.author: DENNIS POLL

customer_reviews.title: Great chair + great price = Score!
customer_reviews.text: These Coleman chairs came recommended through several on-line surveys of "top-rated folding chairs". Caught these chairs on a deal (Under $10ea.). Sturdy construction and heavy material used in this chair. Personally I wish it reclined just a little bit more but I'm not complaining. Well worth the price and looking forward to years of outdoor activity with these.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Costopoulos

customer_reviews.title: Poor design, won’t fold up
customer_reviews.text: We got this chair to carry around with us for outside social distance visits with friends. After the first time we used it, it wouldn’t fold up. We assumed we were obviously overlooking something really simple. Two months later and after asking about how to fold it up and hearing lots of people say it’s simple (and after having everyone who visits our home give it a try), pretty sure we got a faulty chair.
customer_reviews.author: Lora

customer_reviews.title: Nice quick chairs.
customer_reviews.text: We use these when taking our show cars to car shows. They store neatly in the trunk and are super quick and easy to set up and take back down. Plus the mesh surfaces allow air to get to your back keeping it from sweating like you would in a solid backed chair. Work great for what we bought them for.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Ward

customer_reviews.title: Fits Various Body Aizes
customer_reviews.text: My husband is 6 feet and ops little over 200 pounds. He loves this chair. I like it better for me than the inexpensive one I purchased on Amazon and I'm only 5'2" and weight 130. Being so small, I usually have trouble fining a chair that allows both of my arms to rest comfortably close enough to my body, but this one still works fine for the both of us.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Great chair!
customer_reviews.text: I seem to recall someone's review stating the chair was small....not so! It's standard, light, easy to set up and fold up. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality. The seat ripped after 6 uses. I’m only 185 lbs. surely it should have lasted for years.
customer_reviews.author: Paul albritton

customer_reviews.title: Great to take anywhere
customer_reviews.text: This chair has given me so much joy as I use it when I go to outside concerts, plays, to watch sports or just to sit by the water. Easy to carry and to set up and put back in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Logsdon

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing durability
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camp chair for about 5 weeks, probably have used it 15 times, and this arm has already torn off the rivet
customer_reviews.author: B. Kall

customer_reviews.title: Buy the larger, blue Coleman folding chair!
customer_reviews.text: A bit flimsy, probably not suited for a larger person. Very light. The color is pinkish and not very attractive. We also bought the larger, blue Coleman chair for $3 more and it is MUCH stronger, heavier, larger, and more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair!
customer_reviews.text: Feels very sturdy. There are a couple little things that seem "cheap", but I don't think it will break. It is a little difficult to fold sometimes and I feel like I have to "hug" it to push all the sides in evenly, or else it will stick sometimes. Overall good, comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Good camp chair, VERY durable - but cup holder is sized incorrectly
customer_reviews.text: Well, it's a good chair for the price. I'm not sure that it's better than any other camp chairs I've ever bought, though - only time will tell to see how long this one lasts before breaking. But it supports me and I'm at about 230. EDIT - I've had this chair for three years now, and it's still going strong. However, the cupholder is precisely the wrong size. It only holds 16 ounce water bottles - not 24-ounce, not 20-ounce. And it doesn't hold a can, either - of soda or beer. Just water; that's it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Groubert

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty chairs
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for my fire department for rehab. When a 200 lb firefighter and their 40 lbs of gear flop in a cheap chair they will tear it up. These have a 250 lb rating and seem to hold up well. Also the seats don't seam to sag and that makes them easier to get out of.
customer_reviews.author: Firedog

customer_reviews.title: An alright, get-by with, chair
customer_reviews.text: I used one of these chair when I first saw one in the 80's or 90's and it was a comfortable chair. It was also a Coleman but it just felt better. This chair has a large dip in the seat area and it traps you in it a bit. This cause the front part of the seat to dig into the legs a bit. I also found the back a bit too upright. For short outtings and for a kid it might be alright. Oh, also the cover bag is permeable so it will let in rain it covered with it.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Partridge

customer_reviews.title: Coleman wuality in a light weight chair!
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased for beach trip. Has now become the chair that is always in my car just in case. Love that it is Coleman, great quality, but not so heavy.
customer_reviews.author: vbgrin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price top quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these used and they came in excellent condition and very good price thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horribly uncomfortable chair.
customer_reviews.text: It looks great, and it's easy to unfold and fold back up, but none of that matters because it's uncomfortable to sit in! I unfolded it inside to try it out and basically immediately boxed it back up again to return it. When I say down, the chair made my back hunch and was really awkward. I was surprised, too, because other Coleman chairs have been great. Unfortunately I cannot recommend this particular product.
customer_reviews.author: booklover

customer_reviews.title: Chair too small
customer_reviews.text: Too small and uncomfortable for a large individual. I am 6'2"" and a large build 240 lbs. Couldn't sit in chair for any period of time Sent back for a refund and that was handled well. Chair probably better suited to for smaller frame folks
customer_reviews.author: Big T

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: The price is great for what you get. My previous chairs were a little thicker in build, fabric, and features, but cost twice as much. If you need some back up chairs this would do fine. I didn't put 5 stars because of the carrying bag is on the super cheap side and I don't get 100% confidence that that chairs will hold up for many beach seasons.
customer_reviews.author: masterclef5

customer_reviews.title: Love these chairs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for extra seating on my back porch and they are perfect. Guests tell me how comfortable they are and really like the convenient cup holder. My favorite feature is the price I got at the time. I’ve seen less expensive but they’re not made as well as a Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: T. Michael

customer_reviews.title: this chair is fine. Works great
customer_reviews.text: Dont kisten to these whiners. Seriously. 16 bucks, this chair is fine. Works great. Im 6'2" 240lbs and im not crying. Not for 16 bucks! I bought 4 more for the kids. Boom!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Perry

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these again after our old one broke. They lasted for at least 10 years before the fabric finally gave out at a seam on one of them. One is still going. Better than the cheap ones you get at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Val Dobson

customer_reviews.title: not the most comfortable chairs, you kind of sink into them and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for weekend soccer games, they are ok, not the most comfortable chairs, you kind of sink into them and they don't give much back support, but I guess they are better then sitting on hard bleachers. They fold up nicely and the carrying case is handy. Fabric and build seem to be good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Othello_37

customer_reviews.title: Easy to store and use
customer_reviews.text: As a softball family, this chair is a must! Easy to store and use - mesh back is nice for those hot days!!
customer_reviews.author: DLo722

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh
customer_reviews.text: This chair is really no better than a chair from Walmart which would be half the price I’m sure. The back of this chair is all mesh which, from the picture doesn’t look like it’s mesh all the way through but it is. I wouldn’t have gotten this if I knew it was a completely see through mesh back!
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for price
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality for the price. Bought this chair for my daughter for when we are camping. She loves it and says it is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Grim

customer_reviews.title: BROKE AFTER 2ND DAY OF USE
customer_reviews.text: I am a 6'2" 240lb old guy, well underneath the maximum weight tolerance for this product. To get out of a camping chair like this, I lean forward, grasp the end of the armrests, and push. I had used this chair for 2 consecutive evenings. On the second night, the left armrest support broke; literally tore apart.
customer_reviews.author: Erik With A K

customer_reviews.title: Larger than you might imagine
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the younger kids (five and three), thinking they would be a smaller version of our captain chairs, but they ended up being the same size. They seem pretty sturdy, so hopefully they last and the kids will grow into them.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Fields

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend for anyone over 170 lbs.
customer_reviews.text: Used about 10 days before arm material ripped loose from rivet. I like the mesh back. Overall seems adequately sturdy for me at 165 lbs, but don't imagine it would hold up for the supposed 250 lb limit. Can't complain too much considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: W. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Compact and comfortable camping chair.
customer_reviews.text: They are small enough to pack easily in the trunk and are more comfortable then some I have tried. This is my second set of Coleman camping chairs and they are still my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: Narrow chair, small cup holder
customer_reviews.text: The chair is more narrow than other camping chairs I've owned, making it less comfortable. Also, the cup holder is too small for a typical water bottle. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: COMFY, LIGHTWEIGHT AND WELL-MADE  what more do you want?
customer_reviews.text: Perfect chair for 77 yr. old like me who loves the beach but is just not getting into those low beach chairs and up like I used to
customer_reviews.author: PATRICIA W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the RV
customer_reviews.text: Better than those from Sporting good stores and discount stores.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Egan

customer_reviews.title: Poor cup design and sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this chair for this soccer season which started mid August. It already lost a bolt out of one of the legs last month, after only being used 6 times. The cup holder is also too small to hold a standard drink bottle. I was so excited about the mesh back to stay cooler during hot games but I'm really disappointed in the quality of this Coleman chair. I expected better from them as we've purchased many Coleman items over the years without issue.
customer_reviews.author: NB in the LCM

customer_reviews.title: These are not the chairs you are looking for...
customer_reviews.text: Super poor quality. Made me question if these were actually Coleman brand. We ordered two and at least one to two foot pads have crumbled or cracked. We have other Coleman chairs and the materials of these two do not compared to the others.
customer_reviews.author: G O

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Good product. We bought two chairs for my step-son's soccer games. It was easy to get in and out of the bag. It is very light and easy to carry on your shoulder. My husband is 6'4" and right at about 250 lbs, he seems to fit well and the chair seems to be sturdy. This chair has one cup holder and a mesh back, which is nice. My only wish is that it had a clip where you could add an umbrella and maybe another cup holder, but it seems to be a good value at this price (~$15).
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. MacAfee

customer_reviews.title: A marvelous invention. I love my Coleman camping chair.
customer_reviews.text: I used this chair all summer to sit in the back yard. However this weekend I took it camping and sat in it around the campfire most of the day. I took it inside my tent at night to use when I was not sleeping. I love everything about it. And it was at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: David Squires

customer_reviews.title: Good posture!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality chair. Lightweight. Very “straight” back, there will be no slouching allowed while trying to relax in this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Toddler Mom

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of garbage. Bought two of these chairs and one broke the first time it was used. It's clear it's from poor workmanship and should never have passed quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice solid chairs, pack relatively small, relatively light. No thrills, but also no problems. They do what they are supposed to do, and do it well. And cheap. I'm happy with them - warmly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Doru C

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love it for grandson's soccer games. Lightweight but sturdy and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Bad build very dangerous . Cut my leg when the arm broke
customer_reviews.text: First one broke. The arm broke and cut my leg - was sent another one it did the same thing and cut my arm .theres just a tiny bit of metal holding it together where the screw attaches the arm to the frame. The screw is too big
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: OK, but not the most comfortable of the Coleman lineup.
customer_reviews.text: These chairs force you to sit a bit more 'upright' than you may want. We ultimately preferred the oversized quad captains chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Norman J Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Everything Perfect Except Not So Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight, easy to carry, simple to erect, great price, and goes back into bag with no trouble. But, it's not all that comfortable because it encourages a rounded back. But even that is okay if you won't be sitting too long.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie

customer_reviews.title: The chairs are very nice
customer_reviews.text: I sat in he chair out side talking to friends all day. Chair did not hurt my butt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Always shop Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Thank you very. to sit my apartment on nice day and a cold beer... thank you again Stay healthy. God bless you Manuel
customer_reviews.author: MANUEL LOZANO

customer_reviews.title: They come with easy carry bags. Single person, non-adjustable. OK, but not overly comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry and setup. Upright only. Came with a carry bag. OK for camping, but not the most comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: David Swift

customer_reviews.title: Durable chairs, look great too
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, folds up small, fits into the carrying case. Great for soccer moms and football dads. Also useful for beach trips. I bought two and have been very satisfied with how durable they are.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. RobTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair for the Great Outdoors!
customer_reviews.text: This is nice and sturdy--just what I need to take with me for my grandson's soccer games and other events. I love the color. When it's set up, it is very stable--even has a cup holder. What more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: CarolTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Seem sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These seem sturdy and are easy to fold, however they are not very comfortable for an adult. Gave to my kids and bought GCI chairs for my husband and I.
customer_reviews.author: SLM

customer_reviews.title: Annoying to use
customer_reviews.text: Not the easiest to take out, even more difficult to put away. Overall pretty cheap quality and an annoyance rather than convenient.
customer_reviews.author: DCRyan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, and can support my 210lb weight no problem!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, sturdy and can support my 210lb weight. Fits well in the bag it comes with. Have used it the past 4 campings in windy desert condition, still in tiptop condition. Only complaint i have is, when seated my back is straight like perpendicular to my legs, would have been better if i could lean a few degrees back
customer_reviews.author: Outdoorguy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all occasions
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these for kids sporting events, camping, etc... They work perfectly in the Georgia heat. They are better made than I thought they would be. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Came promptly - good price

customer_reviews.text: This chair is fine -- feels fairly sturdy although we have only had it for a handful of soccer weekends so far. The carrying bag is fine so far, but it seems fairly flimsy so not sure how long it will last. This is a good chair for the money.

customer_reviews.title: Good chairs
customer_reviews.text: We took these chairs camping this weekend and used them for the first time. They seem very sturdy and are comfortable to sit in for a few hours around the fire. They did get wet some and seemed to not dry out very quickly, but we were in a rain forest so it could have just been the humidity in the air. They easily fit back into their carrying case. Would buy more if we need them.

product_meta.title: Coleman Broadband Mesh Quad Camping Chair
product_meta.description: Bring a comfortable seat with you to the campsite with the Coleman Broadband Mesh Quad Camping Chair. Ideal for camping, picnics, or backyard barbeques, this versatile folding chair offers premium comfort in a roomy yet portable design. It features a breathable mesh back that allows the breeze to cool your back on hot days, plus an integrated mesh cup holder that keeps a refreshing beverage within your reach. Designed to ensure your comfort, the chair features an extra-wide 21.3-inch seat that offers plenty of room to lounge and adjustable arms that let you customize the chair to suit your preferences. The strong steel frame can support up to 250 pounds and withstands seasons of heavy use. And thanks to its collapsible design and convenient carrying bag, this folding chair is easy to store and transport.
